H0.text: Texture is the property of minerals that the students are investigating by scraping their schoolâ€‘yard rock samples against a piece of quartz from the school lab.

H1.text: Hardness is the property of minerals that the students are investigating by scraping their rock samples against a piece of quartz from the school lab.

H2.text: Color is the mineral property the students are investigating when they scrape their rock samples from the school yard against a piece of quartz from the school lab.

H3.text: Streak is the property of minerals that the students are investigating when they scrape rock samples from the school yard against a piece of quartz from the school lab.

A4.text: The Mohs scale is based on the ability of one natural sample of mineral to visibly scratch another mineral.

A5.text: The hardness of a material is measured against the scale by finding the hardest material that the given material can scratch, or the softest material that can scratch the given material.
